page.title: 01LONGDENDALE - A REVIEW
page.content: The Longdendale Valley is situated on the western side of the Peak National Park. It is a mix of urban and rural areas. The four villages making up the urban aspect are Hollingworth, Hadfield, Tintwistle and Padfield. The rural area is mainly grazing for cattle and sheep in the valley while above is rough pasture and moorland. During the 19th Century many cotton mills were built in the area and during the 1870-1890 period there was a population increase. Now any mills that remain have been converted to other uses mainly small businesses. New housing developments have taken place particularly in Hollingworth and Hadfield and there has been a large population increase since the 1960s.
